titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Selah Strong Wood account book 1973.212
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-08T14:42-0500

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Selah Strong Woodhull (1786-1826) served as a minister at the Old First Reformed Church in Brooklyn, New York from 1806 to 1825.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Selah Strong Woodhull account book consists of a single bound volume and spans the period 1818 to 1822, during which Strong was a minister at the Old First Reformed Church in Brooklyn. The account book records transactions both personal (including purchases of shoes, clothing, fabric, etc.) and pertinent to official church business (such as payments for the rental or purchase of church pews).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Selah Strong Woodhull account book, 1973.212, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
